Patent Information.Patent Title: Selectively targeted antimicrobial peptides and the use thereof.
Patent Information.Abstract: The present invention relates to targeting peptides capable of specifically binding to microbial organisms (e.g., P. aeruginosa or S. mutans), antimicrobial peptides having antimicrobial activities, and specifically/selectively targeted antimicrobial peptides (STAMPs). In addition, the present invention provides methods of selectively killing or inhibiting microbial organisms by using the peptides or compositions provided by the present invention.

Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the frog skin active peptide family (Brevinin subfamily)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.7999137]Gram-positive bacteria:Micrococcus luteus (MIC=5 µg/ml), Staphylococcus epidermidis (MIC=50 µg/ml), Bacillus subtilis (MIC=50 µg/ml);Gram-negative bacteria:Klebsiella pneumoniae (MIC=100 µg/ml), Shigella dysentariae (MIC=25 µg/ml), Pseudomonas putida (MIC=50 µg/ml), Pseudomonas aeruginosa (MIC=50 µg/ml), Eshchericia coli (MIC=25 µg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.7999137] It has 0.04% hemolytic activity at 0.1 μg/ml, 0.14% hemolytic activity at 1 μg/ml, 0.51% hemolytic activity at 10 μg/ml, 0.59% hemolytic activity at 100 μg/ml against human red blood cells.
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Function: Has hemolytic activity against rabbit red cells.

Literature.Title: Antimicrobial peptides from the skin of a Korean frog, Rana rugosa.
Literature.Author: Park JM, Jung J-E, Lee BJ.1994
